sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>sun</radical> is rising and there is a <radical>net</radical> covering <radical>someone</radical>, who's being forced to watch as <kanji>dawn</kanji> appears. They've never seen dawn before, and they didn't want to, but you're making them.
meaningInfo: Picture someone tied down in a net as dawn breaks.
readingMnemonic: The someone who saw <kanji>dawn</kanji> for the first time goes on to become sumo wrestling champ <reading>Akebono</reading> Taro (<ja>あけぼの</ja>). He always gazes at the sunrise at dawn before he wrestles and it fills him with strength.
readingInfo: Look at Akebono looking at you as you look at dawn breaking.
